info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 6 at 6:11AM CDT until May 6 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Concho, Irion, Schleicher, Sutton and Tom Green.
* WHEN...Until 915 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 606 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms from Juno to Sonora to Eldorado to Paint Rock to the O.H. Ive Reservoir. Movement was east at 30 mph. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The heaviest rainfall of 2 1/2 to 3 inches extended from Mertzon to San Angelo to Veribest, Harriet and Lowake.
- Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Angelo, Sonora, Eldorado, Mertzon, Paint Rock, Christoval, Eden, Knickerbocker, Wall, Lake Nasworthy, Twin Buttes Reservoir, Vancourt, Goodfellow Air Force Base, Tankersley, Sherwood, Veribest, Eola, O.C. Fisher Reservoir, San Angelo State Park and Mereta. - This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 381 and 432.
This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Howard and Webster, College Hills and Millbrook, Jackson From Knickerbocker to South Bryant, Southwest Blvd and Loop 306, FM 2334 crossing Ninemile Creek, FM 1929 crossing Fuzzy Creek, Huntington and Sunset, FM 1692 crossing Concho River, FM 1692 crossing Sales Branch and FM 2334 crossing Dry Lipan Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Concho, TX; Irion, TX; Schleicher, TX; Sutton, TX; Tom Green, TX
